user.name: King Efosa MD
user.description: A working brain || Unintentional(ly) man || Available for consultation.

quote.text:
I have always preferred Glovo to Chowdeck. Here are 3 reasons why.

1) Glovo‚Äôs UX is better. Glovo‚Äôs interface is intuitive and context-aware. When I open the app, I am immediately greeted by large, distinct icons that guide me to specific verticals like Food, Groceries, Delivery or Pharmacy. I don‚Äôt have cognitive overload, because when I am in the "Food" section, I only see food options. I think this makes it more accessible for both new and older users. Conversely, Chowdeck's layout often feels overwhelming. I often describe it as "everything, everywhere, all at once".

2) Glovo has no service fee. I am subscribed to both Glovo Prime and Chowpass, and although some people may argue that prices on Glovo are a bit higher, I like that when I select a group of food items, I know exactly how much I am paying in the end. The final checkout price matches the initial selection, as there is no mandatory, surprise fee added at the end. On Chowdeck, you have a selection only to be bumped with a service fee in the end. 

3) Glovo is smarter. When I open the app, it knows my location and automatically changes my delivery to that location. On the other hand, i have to manually edit my location on Chowdeck. I once made a mistake of delivering a Chowdeck package to the location I was previously at simply because they didn‚Äôt read it. Also Glovo can begin to tell the places I often order from and then make suggestions based on that data immediately I open the app so I don‚Äôt have to click too much. 

They are two great platforms by the way but I find myself ordering more from Glovo when I am severely hungry and don‚Äôt want to stress my brain while ordering. üòÖ
